page.title: 12NATURE IN THE WOLDS (contd)
page.content:
Crop spraying is also hazardous to beekeepers. Unless the warning is given to the beekeeper the evening before, so that the bees can be shut in their hives, there is a good chance that they will all be killed if the bees are sprayed in the fields in which they are working.
Pheasant rearing on the Prestwold Estate for its annual shoot has increased the local game bird population with escapees;unfortunately these birds are very tame, and not noted for their high intelligence and often end up as road casualties.
There is also a colony of feral cats around the Hawker Siddely Buildings.
